page.title: 10Newhouse Farm
page.content: Newhouse Farm grows{wheat,beans,oats and also grows{grassland}for the animals to graze on.Last year they grew{barley}but did not this year because it was not a success on the clay.All the crops go to Bartholomew's in{Chichester.}They have worked at this for 5 years. They own 450 acres of land. 70 acres of land is grass and 25 acres of this has recently been created from{woodland}.They own sheep and{cows.}They buy in calves and let them grow for 2 years.They use the hilly parts of the farm to graze on. The{machinery}they use is a combine, 3 tractors, a fork lift truck, 2 ploughs ,a power harrow, trailors, a grass mower,and a hay turner. The farm runs a{pheasant syndicate.}Twelve people pay to come and shoot on the farm. The money pays for the breeding of the pheasants.
